parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the throttle lever can cause the vehicle to lose power, making it difficult to accelerate, which can lead to accidents or leave the driver stranded.
symptoms: The vehicle loses power when accelerating
the accelerator pedal feels unresponsive
the engine RPMs drop unexpectedly
the vehicle hesitates or stumbles when accelerating.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Contaminated Brake Linings and Front Drive Axle Failure
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Contaminated brake linings and front drive axle failure can lead to brake fluid leakage, causing a loss of brake pressure, which can result in extended stopping distances, accidents, and potentially serious injuries or fatalities.
symptoms: Spongy brake pedal
brake fluid leakage
uneven brake wear
grinding or screeching noise when applying brakes
vehicle pulling to one side when braking.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Steering Axle Air Leak and Brake Chamber Failure
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: An air leak in the steering axle hose to brake chamber can cause a loss of brake pressure, leading to extended stopping distances, accidents, and potentially serious injuries or fatalities.
symptoms: Spongy brake pedal
brake fluid leakage
uneven brake wear
grinding or screeching noise when applying brakes
vehicle pulling to one side when braking
air hissing sound when applying brakes.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Sudden tire blowouts, particularly at high speeds, can lead to loss of vehicle control, accidents, and potential injuries or fatalities.
symptoms: Tire blowout with a "zipper effect" (a rapid and catastrophic failure of the tire's sidewall)
often accompanied by a loud noise
loss of vehicle control
and potential damage to the vehicle or surrounding property.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the rear suspension spring assembly can cause the springs to shift out of the center bushing, leading to uneven wear on the tires, reduced vehicle stability, and potential loss of control, which can increase the risk of accidents.
symptoms: The rear suspension springs are shifting out of the center bushing
the "L" shape guards are broken or missing
the springs are making contact with the hanger
the vehicle is experiencing uneven tire wear
the vehicle is pulling to one side while driving.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Improperly Designed or Missing "L" Shape Guards
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The absence or improper design of the "L" shape guards can cause the rear suspension springs to shift out of the center bushing, leading to uneven wear on the tires, reduced vehicle stability, and potential loss of control, which can increase the risk of accidents.
symptoms: The "L" shape guards are broken or missing
the springs are shifting out of the center bushing
the vehicle is experiencing uneven tire wear
the vehicle is pulling to one side while driving.
